node.description: Display a chat message in the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from collections.abc import Generator
from typing import Any

import orjson
from fastapi.encoders import jsonable_encoder

from langflow.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from langflow.helpers.data import safe_convert
from langflow.inputs.inputs import BoolInput, DropdownInput, HandleInput, MessageTextInput
from langflow.schema.data import Data
from langflow.schema.dataframe import DataFrame
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.schema.properties import Source
from langflow.template.field.base import Output
from langflow.utils.constants import (
    MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
    MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
    MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
)


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/components-io#chat-output"
    icon = "MessagesSquare"
    name = "ChatOutput"
    minimized = True

    inputs = [
        HandleInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Inputs",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
            input_types=["Data", "DataFrame", "Message"],
            required=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="background_color",
            display_name="Background Color",
            info="The background color of the icon.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="chat_icon",
            display_name="Icon",
            info="The icon of the message.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text_color",
            display_name="Text Color",
            info="The text color of the name",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="clean_data",
            display_name="Basic Clean Data",
            value=True,
            info="Whether to clean the data",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(
            display_name="Output Message",
            name="message",
            method="message_response",
        ),
    ]

    def _build_source(self, id_: str | None, display_name: str | None, source: str | None) -> Source:
        source_dict = {}
        if id_:
            source_dict["id"] = id_
        if display_name:
            source_dict["display_name"] = display_name
        if source:
            # Handle case where source is a ChatOpenAI object
            if hasattr(source, "model_name"):
                source_dict["source"] = source.model_name
            elif hasattr(source, "model"):
                source_dict["source"] = str(source.model)
            else:
                source_dict["source"] = str(source)
        return Source(**source_dict)

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        # First convert the input to string if needed
        text = self.convert_to_string()

        # Get source properties
        source, icon, display_name, source_id = self.get_properties_from_source_component()
        background_color = self.background_color
        text_color = self.text_color
        if self.chat_icon:
            icon = self.chat_icon

        # Create or use existing Message object
        if isinstance(self.input_value, Message):
            message = self.input_value
            # Update message properties
            message.text = text
        else:
            message = Message(text=text)

        # Set message properties
        message.sender = self.sender
        message.sender_name = self.sender_name
        message.session_id = self.session_id
        message.flow_id = self.graph.flow_id if hasattr(self, "graph") else None
        message.properties.source = self._build_source(source_id, display_name, source)
        message.properties.icon = icon
        message.properties.background_color = background_color
        message.properties.text_color = text_color

        # Store message if needed
        if self.session_id and self.should_store_message:
            stored_message = await self.send_message(message)
            self.message.value = stored_message
            message = stored_message

        self.status = message
        return message

    def _serialize_data(self, data: Data) -> str:
        """Serialize Data object to JSON string."""
        # Convert data.data to JSON-serializable format
        serializable_data = jsonable_encoder(data.data)
        # Serialize with orjson, enabling pretty printing with indentation
        json_bytes = orjson.dumps(serializable_data, option=orjson.OPT_INDENT_2)
        # Convert bytes to string and wrap in Markdown code blocks
        return "```json\n" + json_bytes.decode("utf-8") + "\n```"

    def _validate_input(self) -> None:
        """Validate the input data and raise ValueError if invalid."""
        if self.input_value is None:
            msg = "Input data cannot be None"
            raise ValueError(msg)
        if isinstance(self.input_value, list) and not all(
            isinstance(item, Message | Data | DataFrame | str) for item in self.input_value
        ):
            invalid_types = [
                type(item).__name__
                for item in self.input_value
                if not isinstance(item, Message | Data | DataFrame | str)
            ]
            msg = f"Expected Data or DataFrame or Message or str, got {invalid_types}"
            raise TypeError(msg)
        if not isinstance(
            self.input_value,
            Message | Data | DataFrame | str | list | Generator | type(None),
        ):
            type_name = type(self.input_value).__name__
            msg = f"Expected Data or DataFrame or Message or str, Generator or None, got {type_name}"
            raise TypeError(msg)

    def convert_to_string(self) -> str | Generator[Any, None, None]:
        """Convert input data to string with proper error handling."""
        self._validate_input()
        if isinstance(self.input_value, list):
            return "\n".join([safe_convert(item, clean_data=self.clean_data) for item in self.input_value])
        if isinstance(self.input_value, Generator):
            return self.input_value
        return safe_convert(self.input_value)

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.
data_template.name: data_template

input_value.info: Message to be passed as output.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

text_color.info: The text color of the name
text_color.name: text_color

from langflow.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from langflow.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from langflow.inputs.inputs import BoolInput
from langflow.io import (
    DropdownInput,
    FileInput,
    MessageTextInput,
    MultilineInput,
    Output,
)
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.utils.constants import (
    MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
    MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
    MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
)


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.langflow.org/components-io#chat-input"
    icon = "MessagesSquare"
    name = "ChatInput"
    minimized = True

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Input Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
            input_types=[],
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
            temp_file=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="background_color",
            display_name="Background Color",
            info="The background color of the icon.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="chat_icon",
            display_name="Icon",
            info="The icon of the message.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="text_color",
            display_name="Text Color",
            info="The text color of the name",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Chat Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    async def message_response(self) -> Message:
        background_color = self.background_color
        text_color = self.text_color
        icon = self.chat_icon

        message = await Message.create(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
            properties={
                "background_color": background_color,
                "text_color": text_color,
                "icon": icon,
            },
        )
        if self.session_id and isinstance(message, Message) and self.should_store_message:
            stored_message = await self.send_message(
                message,
            )
            self.message.value = stored_message
            message = stored_message

        self.status = message
        return message

files.info: Files to be sent with the message.
files.name: files

input_value.info: Message to be passed as input.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.

node.description: Extracts actionable tasks, assignees, and due dates from text using pattern matching.

code.name: code
code.value:
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.inputs import HandleInput
from langflow.io import Output
from langflow.schema.message import Message
import re
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

# ---------- helpers (Action Item Logic) ----------
# (All helpers remain the same as they handle the core logic correctly)

VERB_TRIGGERS = [
    "send","email","review","approve","draft","write","update","fix","create",
    "schedule","set up","setup","follow up","follow-up","ping","share",
    "prepare","organize","book","call","document","summarize","deploy",
    "ship","merge","assign","clean up","cleanup"
]
VERB_RX = r"(?:{})(?:\b|$)".format("|".join(sorted(set(map(re.escape, VERB_TRIGGERS)), key=len, reverse=True)))

WEEKDAY_MAP = {
    "monday":0,"mon":0,"tuesday":1,"tue":1,"tues":1,"wednesday":2,"wed":2,
    "thursday":3,"thu":3,"thur":3,"thurs":3,"friday":4,"fri":4,"saturday":5,
    "sat":5,"sun":6
}

# Regex Patterns for Assignments
ASSIGNMENT_PATTERNS = [
    rf"""
    (?P<full_match>^.*?)
    (?P<assignee>(?:@?\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s[A-Z][a-z]+)?\b|@[\w\.-]+))
    \s*(?:to|will|should|must|needs\s+to)\s+
    (?P<task>.*?)
    (?:\s+(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+(?P<due>[^.;,\n]+))?
    (?=[.;\n]|$|\n)
    """,
    rf"""
    (?P<full_match>^.*?)
    (?P<assignee>(?:@?\b[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s[A-Z][a-z]+)?\b|@[\w\.-]+))
    \s*:\s*
    (?P<task>.*?)
    (?:\s+(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+(?P<due>[^.;,\n]+))?
    (?=[.;\n]|$|\n)
    """,
    rf"""
    (?:^|\n)(?:[-*]\s+|\d+\.\s+)?(?P<task>(?:(?!- \[).)*?\b{VERB_RX}.*?)
    (?:\s+(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+(?P<due>[^.;,\n]+))?
    (?=[.;\n]|$)
    """
]
ASSIGNMENT_RES_SPECIFIC = [re.compile(p, re.IGNORECASE | re.VERBOSE | re.MULTILINE | re.DOTALL) for p in ASSIGNMENT_PATTERNS[:2]]
ASSIGNMENT_RES_GENERAL = re.compile(ASSIGNMENT_PATTERNS[2], re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE)

CHECKBOX_RE = re.compile(
    rf"(?:^|\n)-\s*\[\s*\]\s*(?P<task>.*?)(?:\s+(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+(?P<due>[^.;,\n]+))?(?=[.;\n]|$)",
    re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE
)

DUE_TOKEN_RE = re.compile(r"(?:^|\s)(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+", re.IGNORECASE)

DATE_FORM_RXES = [
    re.compile(r"\b(\d{4})-(\d{1,2})-(\d{1,2})\b"),
    re.compile(r"\b(\d{1,2})/(\d{1,2})(?:/(\d{2,4}))?\b"),
    re.compile(r"\b(Jan|Feb|Mar|Apr|May|Jun|Jul|Aug|Sep|Sept|Oct|Nov|Dec|January|February|March|April|June|July|August|September|October|November|December)\.?\s+(\d{1,2})(?:,\s*(\d{4}))?\b", re.IGNORECASE),
]

def _today():
    return datetime(2025, 10, 7).date()

def parse_relative_due(text: str):
    if not text: return None
    t = text.strip().lower()
    if t in ("eod","by eod","before eod","today"): return _today()
    if t in ("tomorrow",): return _today() + timedelta(days=1)
    if t in ("eow","end of week"):
        today = _today(); dow = today.isoweekday(); return today + timedelta(days=(7 - dow))
    if t == "next week":
        today=_today(); dow=today.weekday(); d=(7-dow)%7; d=7 if d==0 else d; return today+timedelta(days=d)
    if t.startswith("next "):
        wd = t.replace("next ","").strip().lower()
        if wd in WEEKDAY_MAP:
            today=_today(); target=WEEKDAY_MAP[wd]; cur=today.weekday()
            d=(target-cur)%7; d=7 if d==0 else d; return today+timedelta(days=d)
    if t in WEEKDAY_MAP:
        today=_today(); target=WEEKDAY_MAP[t]; cur=today.weekday()
        d=(target-cur)
        if d < 0:
            d += 7
        return today+timedelta(days=d)
    return None

def parse_any_date(text: str):
    rel = parse_relative_due(text)
    if rel: return rel.isoformat()
    for rx in DATE_FORM_RXES:
        m = rx.search(text)
        if not m: continue
        if rx is DATE_FORM_RXES[0]:
            try: y,mo,d = map(int,m.groups()); return datetime(y,mo,d).date().isoformat()
            except ValueError: continue
        elif rx is DATE_FORM_RXES[1]:
            mo,d,y = m.groups(); mo,d = int(mo),int(d)
            if y:
                y = int(y); y = y+2000 if y<70 else (y+1900 if y<100 else y)
            else:
                y = _today().year
            try: return datetime(y,mo,d).date().isoformat()
            except ValueError: continue
        else:
            mon_str,d,y = m.groups(); d=int(d)
            mon_map={"jan":1,"feb":2,"mar":3,"apr":4,"may":5,"jun":6,"jul":7,"aug":8,"sep":9,"sept":9,
                     "oct":10,"nov":11,"dec":12,"january":1,"february":2,"march":3,"april":4,"june":6,
                     "july":7,"august":8,"september":9,"october":10,"november":11,"december":12}
            mon_key = mon_str.lower()
            if mon_key not in mon_map: continue
            mo = mon_map[mon_key]
            y = int(y) if y else _today().year
            try: return datetime(y,mo,d).date().isoformat()
            except ValueError: continue
    return None

def clean_due_phrase(due: str) -> str:
    return DUE_TOKEN_RE.sub("", (due or "")).strip(" .,:;")

def extract_candidates(text: str):
    items = []
    text = re.sub(r"[â€¢Â·â–º]+", "-", text).replace("\r", "")
    
    for m in CHECKBOX_RE.finditer(text):
        task = (m.group("task") or "").strip()
        due_raw = clean_due_phrase(m.group("due") or "")
        due_iso = parse_any_date(due_raw) if due_raw else None
        items.append({"assignee": None, "task": task, "due_raw": due_raw or None, "due": due_iso})

    for rx in ASSIGNMENT_RES_SPECIFIC:
        for m in rx.finditer(text):
            task = (m.group("task") or "").strip()
            if not re.search(VERB_RX, task, flags=re.IGNORECASE): continue
            assignee = m.groupdict().get("assignee")
            if assignee: assignee = assignee.strip()
            due_raw = clean_due_phrase(m.groupdict().get("due") or "")
            task = re.sub(r"\s+(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+[^.;,\n]+$", "", task, flags=re.IGNORECASE).strip()
            due_iso = parse_any_date(due_raw) if due_raw else None
            items.append({"assignee": assignee, "task": task, "due_raw": due_raw or None, "due": due_iso})
            
    for m in ASSIGNMENT_RES_GENERAL.finditer(text):
        task = (m.group("task") or "").strip()
        if re.match(VERB_RX, task, flags=re.IGNORECASE):
            due_raw = clean_due_phrase(m.groupdict().get("due") or "")
            task = re.sub(r"\s+(?:by|before|due|deadline)\s+[^.;,\n]+$", "", task, flags=re.IGNORECASE).strip()
            due_iso = parse_any_date(due_raw) if due_raw else None
            items.append({"assignee": None, "task": task, "due_raw": due_raw or None, "due": due_iso})

    seen, out = set(), []
    for it in items:
        if not it["assignee"] and re.search(r'(\b[A-Z][a-z]+\b|\@[\w\.-]+).*(to|will|should|must|needs\s+to).*\b{}'.format(VERB_RX), it["task"], flags=re.IGNORECASE):
            continue
        key = ((it["assignee"] or "").lower(), it["task"].lower(), it["due"] or it["due_raw"] or "")
        if key in seen: continue
        seen.add(key); out.append(it)
        
    return out

# --- FINAL REVISED FORMATTING FUNCTION ---
def format_output_message(items):
    current_date_str = datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
    
    # Check for no items found
    if not items:
        # Move the emoji immediately after the header text and use a single newline
        # to see if it helps with visibility and line breaks in the UI.
        return f"ðŸš¨ Action Items ({current_date_str}) \n\n_No clear action items found._"
    
    lines = [f"ðŸš¨ Action Items ({current_date_str})\n"]
    
    for it in items:
        who = it["assignee"] or "*Unassigned*"
        task = it["task"]
        due = it["due"] or it["due_raw"]
        
        # Format: â€¢ *Assignee* â€” Task Description â€” (*Due/by: Date*)
        line = f"â€¢ *{who}* â€” {task}"
        if due:
            due_prefix = "Due" if it["due"] else "by"
            line += f" â€” (*{due_prefix}: {due}*)"
        
        # Use a single newline for clean separation within the final output string
        lines.append(line + "\n") 
    
    # Join with no separator between items, relying on the single newline added inside the loop
    return "\n".join(lines).strip()
# ----------------------------------------

# --------------------------------------------------------------------------

class ActionItemExtractorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Action Item Extractor"
    description = "Extracts actionable tasks, assignees, and due dates from text using pattern matching."
    documentation: str = "https://github.com/logspace-ai/langflow/wiki/Custom-Components"
    icon = "check-square"
    name = "ActionItemExtractor"
    
    inputs = [
        HandleInput(
            name="input_text",
            display_name="Text Input (Notes/Transcript)",
            info="The unstructured text to analyze for action items.",
            input_types=["Message", "Data", "Text"],
            required=True,
        ),
    ]
    
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Action Items (Formatted)", name="message", method="extract_action_items"),
    ]

    async def extract_action_items(self) -> Message:
        input_data = self.input_text
        if hasattr(input_data, 'text'):
            text = input_data.text
        elif isinstance(input_data, str):
            text = input_data
        else:
            text = str(input_data)
        
        if not text:
            output_str = format_output_message([])
            items = []
        else:
            items = extract_candidates(text)
            output_str = format_output_message(items)

        message = await Message.create(
            text=output_str,
            data={"action_items": items}
        )
        self.status = message
        return message

input_text.info: The unstructured text to analyze for action items.
input_text.name: input_text

description: Extracts actionable tasks from unstructured text such as meeting notes, transcripts, or chat logs. It identifies who needs to do what and by when, using pattern-based heuristics.
name: MA42021_transcripts_action_item_extractor
